column4: i have an *apparently* bad usb flash drive. It shows up in win 7 but isn't formated. It doesn't show up in ubuntu 10.04. Is there somewhere else i can look to see it?
there data on it you wanted to keep? or is it brand new?
unplug,plug it back in, check dmesg again. if its not even getting assigned a /dev/sdXX entry - it may be totally dead.
I've been looking in /dev and there's nothing
odd that it shows up in windows.. could be its showing up sometimes.. but not others..
time to back it up.. fast.. :)
as far as i know, you dont override the exec, or rw permissions on an ext2/3/4 filesystem via mount options.
i just opend synaptic and typed 7z
i was just looking in synaptic to see what the suggested installs were
i wouldent advise it.  many apps can be set to use alsa dire3ctly if needed

MonkeyDust: the only reason i'm even thinking about it as a solution is cause i'm experimenting with multiseat. It seems that the only way i can get each seat to have audio is if i run pulse as a system-wide instance instead of per user.
no idea on multiseat, sorry. thats a 'cutting edge' sort of thing. ;)
MonkeyDust: i have it working ok for me, but i want to update https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MultiseatX for 12.04 and have a more complete solution for audio.
